title: How the Color Wheel Works
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on How the Color Wheel Works.

hook.text: Isaac Newton split light through a prism and then bent the spectrum into a circle. The color wheel was born.

buildup.text: The color wheel arranges hues in a circle, showing relationships between primary, secondary, and tertiary colors.

twist.text: Photography uses light primaries: red, green, blue. These differ from the paint primaries you learned in school.

punchline.text: Newton bent a rainbow into a circle. Artists have used it ever since.
